Global File System: Any cluster Posix FS (gfs  gpfs  ocfs  etc.)
Global File System + Kerberos: Any cluster Posix FS (gfs  gpfs  ocfs  etc.)

Authentication: GSI  SSL  Kerberos  Password  File System  Remote File System  Windows  Claim To Be  Anonymous
Global File System + Kerberos: Not official  hack with ACL and NFS4

Global File System: Any  e.g.  NFS  Lustre  GPFS  AFS

CPU scavenging: Yes  supports preemption based on priority

Heterogeneous/ Homogeneous exec node: Heterogeneous - HW and OS agnostic (AIX  Linux or Windows)
Jobs priority: Policy based - no queue to comoutenode binding
Group priority: Policy based - no queue to computegroup binding
Queue type: Batch  interactive  checkpointing  parallel and combinations
SMP aware: yes and GPU aware (GPU License free)
CPU scavenging: Yes  supports preemption based on priority  supports checkpointing/resume
Parallel job: Yes  fx parallel submissions for job collaboration over fx MPI
Job checkpointing: Yes  with support for user  kernel or library level checkpointing environments

Global File System: Arbitrary  e.g. NFS  Lustre  HDFS  AFS
Jobs priority: Yes; automatically policy controlled (e.g. fair-share  deadline  resource dependent) or manual
Group priority: Yes; can be dependent on user groups as well as projects and is governed by policies
Queue type: Batch  interactive  checkpointing  parallel and combinations
SMP aware: Yes  with core binding  GPU and Intel Xeon Phi support
Max exec node: commercial deployments with many tens of thousands hosts
CPU scavenging: Yes; can suspend job on interactive usage
Parallel job: Yes  with support of arbitrary parallel environments such as OpenMPI  MPICH 1/2  MVAPICH 1/2  LAM  etc.
Job checkpointing: Yes  with support for user  kernel or library level checkpointing environments
